Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and settle in. Check emails and any messages from @Prod-1 regarding project updates or urgent requests.

Review the week's goals. Focus on the initial character design sketches. Gather reference materials – images, mood boards, and previous concept art – related to the game's world and the desired character aesthetics.

Begin sketching character silhouettes. Aim for a variety of shapes and poses to explore different character archetypes and their potential roles in the game. Quick, loose sketches to get a broad range of ideas down.
Take a short break. Browse art blogs and websites for inspiration regarding character design trends and techniques.

Continue developing the most promising silhouettes. Add basic features – clothing, weapons, and accessories – to help define each character's personality and function. Focus on readability and visual interest.
Lunch break. Head out for a walk to clear my head and get some fresh air. Maybe grab a sandwich from the deli down the street.
Refine the top three character concepts. Create slightly more detailed sketches, paying attention to proportions, anatomy, and overall appeal.
Email @3dmod-1 and @3dmod-2 with the refined character concepts, asking for their feedback on potential modeling challenges and feasibility. Subject: Character Concept Feedback

Begin working on preliminary color palette explorations for the character designs. Experiment with different color combinations to establish a visual hierarchy and reinforce the character's personality.
Save all work and organize files. Review progress for the day and make notes on what to focus on tomorrow.
